net.openhft.affinity

Class AffinityLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.affinity.AffinityLock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NonForkingAffinityLock

    public class AffinityLock
extends Object
implements Closeable
    This utility class support locking a thread to a single core, or reserving a whole core for a thread.
    Author:
    peter.lawrey

    • Method Detail

      • cpuLayout

        public static void cpuLayout(@NotNull
                             CpuLayout cpuLayout)
        Set the CPU layout for this machine. CPUs which are not mentioned will be ignored.

        Changing the layout will have no impact on thread which have already been assigned. It only affects subsequent assignments.

        Parameters:
        cpuLayout - for this application to use for this machine.

      • cpuLayout

        @NotNull
public static CpuLayout cpuLayout()
        Returns:
        The current CpuLayout for the application.

      • acquireLock

        public static AffinityLock acquireLock()
        Assign any free cpu to this thread.
        Returns:
        A handle for the current AffinityLock.

      • acquireCore

        public static AffinityLock acquireCore()
        Assign any free core to this thread.

        In reality, only one cpu is assigned, the rest of the threads for that core are reservable so they are not used.

        Returns:
        A handle for the current AffinityLock.

      • acquireLock

        public static AffinityLock acquireLock(boolean bind)
        Assign a cpu which can be bound to the current thread or another thread.

        This can be used for defining your thread layout centrally and passing the handle via dependency injection.

        Parameters:
        bind - if true, bind the current thread, if false, reserve a cpu which can be bound later.
        Returns:
        A handle for an affinity lock.

      • acquireCore

        public static AffinityLock acquireCore(boolean bind)
        Assign a core(and all its cpus) which can be bound to the current thread or another thread.

        This can be used for defining your thread layout centrally and passing the handle via dependency injection.

        Parameters:
        bind - if true, bind the current thread, if false, reserve a cpu which can be bound later.
        Returns:
        A handle for an affinity lock.

      • dumpLocks

        @NotNull
public static String dumpLocks()
        Returns:
        All the current locks as a String.

      • bind

        public void bind()
        Bind the current thread to this reservable lock.

      • bind

        public void bind(boolean wholeCore)
        Bind the current thread to this reservable lock.
        Parameters:
        wholeCore - if true, also reserve the whole core.

      • acquireLock

        public AffinityLock acquireLock(AffinityStrategy... strategies)
        Give another affinity lock relative to this one based on a list of strategies.

        The strategies are evaluated in order to (like a search path) to find the next appropriate thread. If ANY is not the last strategy, a warning is logged and no cpu is assigned (leaving the OS to choose)

        Parameters:
        strategies - To determine if you want the same/different core/socket.
        Returns:
        A matching AffinityLock.

      • release

        public void release()
        Release the current AffinityLock which can be discarded.
